title.rendered: Minecraft: Microsoft offers free school version

content.rendered:
Microsoft launches building sandbox game Minecraft des Swedish developer studio Mojang on the market in a free version specially designed for the requirements of school lessons. As of Friday, June 10, 2016, teachers, students and school administrators have free access to the “Minecraft Education Edition”.

Minecraft: Mojang adds new game variant

The trial version is offered free of charge until the official launch of the customer version in September 2016. The costs for the final version have not yet been determined. There is talk of an annual license fee of five US dollars per user. Microsoft specifies a PC with Windows 10 or OS X 10.11 (“El Capitan”) as the system requirement.

With the version of the construction sandbox game specially modified for teaching institutions, classes with up to 30 students can develop joint projects without a dedicated server – for example to graphically illustrate the effects of climate change. The playful approach is intended to encourage students to get involved. The teachers create a game character in the project and guide their students through the game using this identification figure. With the help of screenshots, structures and scenarios created can be documented and intermediate statuses can be discussed.

“Minecraft at school” is not really a new project: the mod “MinecraftEdu” by the Finnish developer “Teacher Gaming” has been around since 2011 and is currently used in more than ten thousand schools in over 40 countries.
